abstract.para: &applet; is an image viewer applet for the GNOME desktop.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: &applet; is an image viewer for your GNOME desktop.
The &applet; applet is able to show a frame on your desktop in which are displayed images and photos from user specified local and online sources.
This manual describes how to set up and use the &applet; applet.

sect1.title: Starting the &applet; applet
sect1.para: To start &applet; select the ApplicationsGraphics Photo Frame entry from the main menu.
Alternatively start &applet; from the shell with the gphotoframe command.
As the &applet; applet is started, you may want to Add one or more sources.

sect1.title: The Photo Frame
sect1.para: The photo frame is the main window of &applet;.

When an image or photo is diplayed, hoovering on it with the mouse pointer will make some icons and a tooltip appears as showed in . The tooltip shows some basic informations about the content as the author name, the image title and the date taken.

textobject.phrase: Shows the photo frame with tooltip and icons

caption.para: The tooltip and the icons showed on the photo frame if the source is flickr photo sharing website

sect1.para: The number and type of icons displayed on the frame corners depends on the content's source. They could be:

listitem.para: fav-icon — if you are logged with your userID to an internet service like flickr, you could add an image to your's profile favorites by clicking on the icon in the upper left of the photo frame. The icon will light up indicating that the image has been added to favorites.
Click again on that icon and the image will be removed from your favorites.
If the contents comes from a local source (such as F-Spot or Shotwell database), there will be five stars so that you can assign a personal vote for the content displayed by clicking on them.

geo-icon — this is a earth shaped icon that appears on the bottom right of the frame if gps (global positioning system) data are available for the content currently displayed. Click on it to open the default web browser in which the content's geographical position will be displayed in google maps.

info-icon — this icon is located on the bottom left of the frame and depict a camera. If you hoover the mouse over it, a tooltip will be displayed containing all the image's metadata (if available) such as camera model and maker, shutter speed, aperture, etc...

service-icon — this icon is displayed in the upper right corner of the frame and shows the symbol of the service from where the content is retrieved. By clicking on the icon, the source will open in your system's default web browser if it is an online service, and in your system's default image viewer, if the content is local.

sect1.title: The Main Menu
sect1.para: The main menu of &applet; could be opened by right clicking inside the photo frame.
In the menu there are the following entries:

listitem.para: Opens the displayed image in a web browser (if the image comes from an online service) or in the default image viewer if the image comes from the local machine.
Shows a list of recently displayed items.
Jump to the next image in the queue.
Enable the fullscreen visualization of gphotoframe.
Fix the photo frame so that it will visible only in the current workspace.
Opens the preferences dialog: see for detailed informations.
Shows the applet's developers and contributors informations as well as the version number.
Terminates the &applet; applet.

sect1.title: Setting the Preferences
sect1.para: The Preferences dialog is accessible by right clicking inside the photo frame and selecting Preferences from the menu.
In the Preferences dialog there are three tabs.

sect2.title: General tab
sect2.para: In the General tab is possible to set some general options for &applet;.

textobject.phrase: Shows the general tab under preferences

caption.para: The General tab in the Preferences dialog

sect2.para: The General tab is composed of three subsections:

listitem.para: Here is possible to set the time interval in seconds beetwen images for the window mode and for the full screen mode.
The maximum display size of the displayed image could be set in the width and height fields.
By checking the first option is possible to make &applet; visible on all workspaces. With the second option is possible to load automatically &applet; on next startup.

sect2.title: Plugins tab
sect2.para: This tab shows the list of plugins currently installed in your system.

textobject.phrase: Shows the plugin tab under preferences

caption.para: The Plugins tab in the Preferences dialog

sect2.para: Plugins could be enabled or disabled with a click on the checking box on the left of plugin's name. Clicking on the About button in the bottom right when a plugin row is highlighted, will display a dialog containing some information regarding the selected plugin.
&applet; ships with the following pre-installed plugins:

listitem.para: F-Spot — shows in GNOME Photo Frame the images in your F-Spot database.

Flickr — display the contents from the popular photo sharing service. This plugin is highly customizable as you can look for photos in different ways for example by specifying a tag, a group, a user or by showing the most interesting or the latest content.
Folder — with this plugin you could add as a source for content a folder that contains image files on your computer.
Picasa Web — display the contents from the google photo hosting service.
RSS and Atom feed — shows images from a RSS or Atom feed.
Ruins clock — gather images of old and abandoned clocks from Haikyo Clock website.
Shotwell — shows in &applet; the images in your Shotwell database.
Tumblr — shows images from the "share anything" online service.

sect2.title: Source tab
sect2.para: In the source tab is possible to manage ( Add, Remove or Edit) the content's sources.

textobject.phrase: Shows the source tab under preferences

caption.para: The Source tab in the Preferences dialog

sect3.title: Adding a source
sect3.para: To add a source of contents to &applet; go to the Preferences dialog and click the New button

In the dialog that will appears, select a source from the pop-up list. Depending on the type of source selected (folder, F-Spot or Shotwell database, internet sharing service as flickr, tumblr or Picasa) different settings are available. Configure them to your liking and then press Ok. A new source will be added to the list and the new content will start to be displayed on the photo frame.
If you want to add more sources just repeat this process.

note.title: Weight
note.para: One of the most important setting if you have more than one source, is weight: the content from the source with the highest weight will be displayed more frequently.

sect3.title: Removing a source
sect3.para: To remove a source just highlight it in the list and press the Remove button.

sect3.title: Editing a source
sect3.para: To modify the settings for an existing source, highlight it's name with a click in the list and then press the Preferences button to open the settings dialog.

sect1.title: Logging to an Online Service
sect1.para: In &applet; is possible to get logged to an online service listed in the Plugins tab if you have an account.
When &applet; is connected with your credentials to an online service, you could add displayed contents to your favorites, vote images and display photos from your account.
To do this go to the Plugins tab. Then highlight the row of the online service plugin you want to get logged in and press the Preferences button.
Insert the information requested (user ID, e-mail address, password etc...), press Ok and follow the instructions provided by the dialog.

note.para: Depending on the service you are logging in, it might be opened the default web browser so that you can give &applet; the required permissions through the online service's webpages. When you terminate this task, go back to &applet; and follow the instructions in the dialog.
